title: Railworks 2012 - Class 423 4VEP
description:
The 4VEP Add-On takes you back to the days of the classic Ã¢â‚¬Ëœslam-doorÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ commuter trains on the Woking-Portsmouth Line.

The 4VEP (Ã¢â‚¬ËœVestibule Electro PneumaticÃ¢â‚¬â„¢), named the Class 423 under the British Rail TOPS classification system, was one of the Ã¢â‚¬Ëœslam-doorÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ electric multiple units that formed the backbone of rail passenger transport in southern England from the 1960s until after 2000. EMUÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s like the 4VEP were a part of daily life to hundreds of thousands of commuters, with the persistent slamming of their doors signalling the imminent departure of another busy service. Each 4-car set was powered by 750-volt DC electricity supplied via a third rail, giving a top speed of 90mph. Built by BREL at York, these classic EMUs served for almost 40 years, their high-density seating layouts and performance proving adequate for their role until the introduction of the more modern Ã¢â‚¬ËœDersiroÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ units. PLEASE NOTE: the 4VEP Add-On requires the Portsmouth Direct Line Expansion Pack (available separately) to play.
